review: Made plans to see a movie at the nearby theater with two of my roommates on Saturday night. We wanted to snag dinner first, so we decided on CPK. We arrived 90 minutes before the movie, and were told that it would be a 15-20 minute wait for a table. That still left us with over an hour for eating and making the two-minute walk to the theater, so we put our name down and settled in to wait. 30 minutes later, one of my roommates checked back in with the hostess, and was told it would be another 5-10 minutes. We were getting tight on time at this point, but didn't have time to go wait somewhere ELSE, so we stayed put. Don't get me wrong, I don't mind waiting for a table, but be HONEST about how long the wait will take in case people have plans -- especially if you're located right by a movie theater, and you KNOW you get a lot of the pre-movie crowds. We were finally seated 40 minutes after our arrival. We had asked for a menu to look over during our wait, so we all knew what we wanted, and ordered both our drinks and our meal when our server came came to the table. Our server brought the drinks right away, and a runner brought our food about 15 minutes later. The delivery of the drinks was the last time we saw our server until we managed to flag him down from across the room when we were entirely done with the meal to request our check. He never bothered to stop by to check on our food, no refills (we ALL had empty glasses), nothing. Yes, the restaurant was busy, but that's no excuse for totally IGNORING a table. The food itself was ok, but nothing special (and certainly not worth waiting for). I had the Pesto Chicken thin crust pizza, and there was so little pesto on it that if I hadn't known it was supposed to be there, I probably would have missed it. the chicken was a bit dried out, too. It felt more like something I'd get from Dominos than something that I'd consider restaurant-quality. My rooommates had a pasta dish (I'm not sure exactly which one, but he said it wasn't bad) and a Jamaican Jerk pizza (I tasted a slice -- again, not bad, but dried-out chicken just like my pizza, and again, felt more like delivery pizza than restaurant pizza). I've been to other CPKs in the past, but have not been to one for some time now, so I have no idea if the overall quality/service standards have fallen for the whole chain, or if this is just a subpar location. Either way, I won't be coming back here.

I really like CPK for lunch. I've ordered online and gone to the restaurant to pick up the food during lunch. Their BBQ pizza with honey wheat crust is really good. I remember having their turkey sandwich once, but I didn't like it because the Dijon mustard overpowered everything about the sandwich. I couldn't even finish it! The last two times I've gone I've had the fish taco once and the next time I had the steak. Both were really good and flavorful. with a squirt of lemon, it added pizazz to each taco. I've also had their Red Velvet cake for dessert and it was wonderful. Definitely worth a shot!

I think I really want to like this place but the service sucks and the food isn't really that great.  I love their tomato soup and salads but their pizza and pasta are not great.  Went here a month ago and ordered the broccoli sun dried tomato fussili and my sister ordered a honey wheat pizza.  My sister's pizza came out and the waiter said mine would be out in a moment but he really meant 10 minutes.  When it did finally come out I got something that looked like spaghetti, I was looking to see where the broccoli was.  When I asked he looked at where he wrote our order and my food and immediatly took it away.  Another 20 minutes later and eating half my sister's pizza I was no longer hungry and asked for it in a to go box.  I ate it for dinner and it tasted like butter noodles with broccoli and sun dried tomatoes.   Came here yesterday with my friend, she ordered a club pizza and I ordered a margarita pizza,  I asked for it to be cooked longer to be crispy on the edges...what I got was a burnt pizza the cheese had turned to rubber and I couldn't even bite off the pizza because it was like rubber.  My friend's pomegranate mojito came out as a regular mojito.  The server also came to our table a total of seven times...this was quite annoying.

This is another Rio location I like to eat at with groups of people. Though not too big...it takes forever to get your food or get your order taken if you have too many people. However, the staff can be really nice about helping you with surprises. We came here for a going away event for a friend and secretly bought her a massive cake and the staff let us put it in the kitchen and brought it out when we were done eating. Granted we were still grumpy with the 1.5 hour wait for our food, but that was really really sweet of them. On other occasions, service has been really slow, but it's a pretty busy spot. The pizzas are good and I love the salads (also love that you can order half salads and that the staff is nice about you wanting to split pizzas instead of everyone ordering their own entree). The drinks are also fun. It's pretty standard CPK food and although I always try new things, the BBQ Pizza with honey wheat crust really is the best dish there.

My company held a team lunch at the CPK in the Rio.  Everyone was enjoying their meals until one co-worker found an extra suprise in her salad. She bit into a jagged piece of clear plastic about 1 1/2 inches long.  After informing our waitress what transpired and telling her the manager was being notified she replied "Okay, no problem". She did not show concern, shock or any empathy. The manager came over and identified the plastic piece. She also lacked empathy and asked if my co-worker wanted to order something else on the house.  The reaction of the staff was as if this type of thing happens all the time. They comped my co-workers salad. A bit more concern should have been expressed. After all there were 13 of us that have this as a lasting impression. We ordered to about $500 worth of food and drinks! We will definitely pick somewhere else near by for our next company lunch.

Stopped by here for dinner a few nights ago, and it was great!  Food came out quickly, food tasted good, and service was there.  The pizza was smaller than I expected, only 6 slices to the pizza.  For appetizer, got  the typical chips and spinach artichoke dip.  No qualms with that.  For the pizza, got 1/2 pear & Gorgonzola, and  1/2 Greek-vegetarian (replace chicken with avocado).  The two types of pizza's do NOT go well together, but both are very good on their own.  (Eating a slice of the Greek that has the Tzatziki sauce after having pear & Gorgonzola that has ranch are two extremes).  For the dessert, had the chocolate soufflé cake + a scoop of Hagen-Dazs.  YUM. Price is right here - not too expensive.  It's a bit loud in the restaurant - many parents brought their kids here.

CPK is one of my favorite chains and never disappoints!  Ordered my usual garlic chicken pizza.  Yum!  Love their variety of toppings and flavors.  You don't pay for quantity, but more for flavor and variety. Our server, Paola, waited on us with a smile.  Will definitely be back for our CPK fix!

Love their Kung pao spaghetti. Sounds weird but I can never forget the flavor. They actually used dried chili to cook and last time I went there my waiter suggested me to have penne pasta instead of regular spaghetti and it was a success. My other favorite pasta is jambalaya. I also loved their thin crust pizza, my dh would get the sausage pepperoni all the time. starters are small portions but worth tasting.

The menu here is one of the most extensive I have seen and I appreciate all the great variety and choices.  I've never disliked anything I ordered.  They have some of the best salad choices I have ever seen.   Mostly I have gotten take out but the one time I went in there to eat it was so freezing cold in the restaurant that it was almost unbearable (my reason for the 4 instead of 5 stars).  I heard from others it is always ridiculously cold in there.  So if you must eat in, bring a warm sweater.

CPK diet tip -- adding lettuce to any dish DECREASES the calories! So I went to CPK with a group of friends from work for lunch, and we noticed that the standard (as opposed to thin crust) pizzas appeared smaller than last time. We asked the server, and he said the pizza size had not changed -- fair enough, our perception could be tricked by plate size or other variables. Later, I checked online (I'm pedantic, I know) and saw that the California Club Pizza I order dropped from 1560 calories in 2010 ( ), to 1515 in 2011 ( ), and now down to 1400. So, again I inquired, this time via CPK's website, relevant excerpts below: CPK: We have not made any changes to our sizes of our pizzas.  They are still 10" round six slices each pizza. ME: I'm still curious -- do you know anything about the calorie count dropping from 1560 to 1400 for the california club pizza? In 2010 it was 1560 calories ( ), in 2011 it was 1515 ( ), and now it's down to 1400. CPK: The only thing that has changed recently in the recipe is the amount of lettuce.  There is more lettuce now on the pizza. So adding lettuce decreases the calorie count? I don't get it... if anyone has an explanation, I would love to hear it. PS -- I really do love the California Club Pizza I order, so much that I want more of it!

I love CPK to start off.  It is one of my favorite chain restaurants.  This location in RIO in Gaithersburg though has been a little bit of a let down.  The past few times I've been there it seemed to take forever to get any food.  This past week I was there and it took at least 30 minutes to get an app and almost an hour to get an main entree.  This has seemed to happen the past few times going.  I have gone at low capacity times and high, and the same problem is always there.  I would completely recommend the food, but make sure you are not going anywhere afterwards because you may be there for a while.  Good news is that the staff in general are very nice, just a little slow.

This was the first CP I ever visited when I came to the US. Thanks to my friend Borat! (His name is a LONG story :p) That was almost 4 years ago! Been here a couple of times after - usually when we want to catch a movie. Visited the place again yesterday and I still love it! I like CPK in general, but this place is great! It can be a bit of a  wait, the food is awesome and  consistent and the service is always great! Love the bar seating area too. I think every time we want to watch a movie at Rios, we end up here for a snack/ lunch/ dinner! :) I love the fact that their Manager is usually around, making sure everything is in order, keeping track of orders and even heling clean up tables sometimes.. the only problem, he never smiles! Sometimes makes me wonder if he is 'that' tyrant people hate working for..?! Anyways, keep it up CPK! :)

Terrible service. We walked into the Gaithersburg CPK only to find the hostess station unattended, but with several of the waitstaff just milling about towards the back of the restaurant. Hostess finally arrived, took our name and told us it would be a 15 minute wait, despite the fact that several tables were empty (but unbussed). We asked to sit outside, after 20 minutes we were shown to a small table inside crammed into a corner behind a large noisy party. We asked for a table outside again, were told our name would now go to the bottom of the list, but not to worry, only one person ahead of us. Forty minutes later we were still waiting, got up and left. And there were several empty tables outside, no one else in the waiting area. So I can't really comment on the food for this visit; on previous visits it has been good, but not worth such bad service. Maybe it was an off night?

This CPK at Rio used to be good but they have gone downhill lately.  Once I ordered a salad to go and found out that they did not give any salad dressing (realized once already home).  Then yesterday we got a table right away but waited and waited for a waiter.  No one seemed to know who was our waiter.  We got up to hit the restroom and someone accidentally bussed our table while we were gone for a minute. I ordered  the thai crunch salad without chicken, then halfway through found chicken pieces in the dish.  So disappointing!  I hope CPK get some new management that can coordinate better.

Have been to this restaurant a few times over the past year, with my most recent visit 2 weeks back. The service has been good, and the food decent. The gorgonzola cheese and pear pizza is worth trying. Love the Crunchy Thai salad.

Only franchise/ chain I really enjoy! I love the Baja rolls, tortilla soup, and how could you not love the original BBQ pizza. Out of the dozen of trips I have taken here never really had a disappointing experience. My new favorite pizza is the chipotle chicken amazing! The strawberry & peach sugar free ice tea is always a +++

We were in the D.C./ Chevy Chase/Bethesda area in Maryland...VERY Good...I didn't realize they had the variety they had.  The appetizers are for those who do not have a big appetite, but the pizza's were big.  We sat at the bar and nice bar tender wait person.

Hi! Went to CPK for the first time ever last night. Food was great! I am finishing my leftover salad for breakfast and it is still flavorful. The down side? We got there at 5:45 and there were approx 6 tables with peop in the main dining room and a private party next to the patio. The restaurant starts to fill up and it is a nice mix of singles and families. There is a waiting line out of the door and there are three hostesses talking with the people waiting. We are getting ready to leave AT 7:45 or so and I decide to head to the ladies room. The most probable reason I won't be back? There is no toilet paper in ANY of the stalls in the womens room, NOR are their any papertowels to dry your hands.  TOTALLY unacceptable.
This place is pretty good. It's not the best and it's not the worst. It could be a little better. The service, for example. It's very cramped and please do NOT take your kids.

I gave it 3 stars but 2 was also on my mind.  I have been going here for years - not often but for a long time.  Our office is near by so it's one of the choices that come up for birthday lunches etc. Biggest issue I have is the declining service.  They are just getting slower and slower.

I love CPK. Always have, always will.  Honestly, it would take some really bad service or vile food to make me give this anything less than a 4. And not return. Since this is a VERY popular (super busy) location - CALL AHEAD. While they do not take reservations, they will add your name to the list and significantly cut down your wait. Our Friday night 6:30 pm dinner wait was 10 minutes as opposed to 50+ min. The salads are great. The bbq chicken salad here is my favorite. The full at  $13.50 is my favorite but it should include avocado at that price. My mom loves the Kung Pao Spaghetti. Which for a non-meat version at only $10 is a steal! Oh and I love the "small plates" concept! Chips and guacamole for $3.75, quesadilla at $5 - great add-ons without paying the full appetizer approach! Looking for quality at a reasonable price and kid friendly (definitely very energetic noise levels) - go to CPK!  And build some time to walk around Rio, shop, take a paddle boat out on the water, or catch a movie!

I come here with my wife often and have eater here about half a dozen times. I like food and atmosphere, service is good. During my last visit, I ordered extra guacamole with my sandwich. They were out of it so waitress came and apologized. it was no big deal for me. But then the manager came and introduced himself. He apologized for not having guacamole offered us to pick any item from the dessert menu on the house. He even made recommendation. I thanked him  but was not in a mood.  He came again and took a big chunk out of our bill. There was really no need for it as it is just a trivial thing. But you can imagine the attitude as they want to keep their customers happy even for such a small thing. I would highly recommend this place to anybody for a top notch service!

We've been to this franchise in the past and have had good experience. The service last time was mediocre at best. We waited for someone to take our order 20 min after we were seated, and it wasn't even a busy day. The bartender messed up our drinks too. 3 stars for food.

pretty standard CPK, nothing special other than its near the lake.   several things really peaved me about my visit.  I ordered a Hawaiin BBQ chicken pizza, priced $13.50.  no big deal.  the pizza itself is only slightly better than the CPK you can make yourself from the frozen food section of your local supermarket, for half the price, but i digress... the waiter asked "you want some bacon on that?" as if it was an option, a free option, not mentioning that a couple free bacon bites would be extra.  I thought to myself, sure why not.  they charged my $1.50 for the bacon.  now $1.50 isn't much, and i can easily afford it without breaking the bank.  It's just the fact that i could have easily done without bacon on my pizza, and if i had known that it was extra, would not have gotten it.  It's also the fact that they want to upsell items, not telling you they are extra.   also, my GF just usually drinks water at restaurants because she's healthy.  when she asked for water, he said "would you like Fiji water? or sparking water?" not even offering her just regular tap water.  She was smart enough to realize that, and just said tap water... i like paying for good food, i don't like paying for mediocre food, and getting an upsell...

Dropped in after eating at pot bellys for a quick dessert at 3:30 on a monday. There was no host/hostess so I just sat at the bar. I waited for a waiter to come around and told him I just wanted quick dessert. It was out in less then 5 minutes. The guy was very friendly and seemed to be handling a lot, carry out, tables, and me. The tiramisu was awesome! I was with a friend and we were fighting for the last few bites.  Will definitely come back and grab a salad, they looked pretty good. P.S Buy a $100 gift card get $20 gift card for later use!
They need to change up there menu, same stuff all the time, but i do like how they added fish tacos, atleast that is a plus.

We normally love CPK, and we like the Montgomery Mall CPK much better than this location.  This location during lunch on weekdays has extremely slow service.  Which is strange because they are never that busy during lunch time.  We have had to wait half an hour for food (when you only have one hour lunch break), and the pizza came out cold, which meant it was sitting there waiting for a while.  It's not one particular waitress, we've had different waiters/waitresses, and all had slow service.  I've told people never ever going to this particular CPK. Food taste fine, like all CPK, just cold sometimes.  My mom swears their avocado roll appetizer, the rolls are much smaller than the Montgomery Mall location.  I didn't pay particular attention so I can't say for sure.

Stopped in for dinner with the family this evening.  CPK is a bit bipolar.  They have wine glasses sitting on the table when you are seated yet provide set ups with paper napkins tossed on your table.   My kids think of this as a pizza place.  I really prefer a place where you can order your pizza however you want.  At CPK, you order from a preset list.  Prices are $12 -14 or so for a pizza that will feed two if neither of you are very hungry.   This evening we shared a Mushroom, Sausage, and Pepperoni pizza, a BBQ Chicken Hawaiian pizza and an Italian Salad.  The BBQ pizza had a thin and crisp crust.  The sauce is smokey and sweet and both the pineapple and chicken pieces are large.  It also has sliced onions which we're divided on.  My oldest and i enjoy them, the spouse and the middle kid pick them off. The Mushroom, Sausage, and Pepperoni pizza was severely under cooked.  The crust was doughy but the top was well cooked.  Not sure, maybe it was in the wrong part of the oven.   My youngest got a kids cheese pizza and devoured it so she seemed happy.  Not much to say about the salad.  It's a chopped salad, well dressed, and the deli meets are finely shredded.  Not a stand out but fine. Our server was attentive, kept the kids drinks full, and was there when we needed him.  No issues, at all. Now through the end of March, you can download a coupon for $10 off on a check of $40 or more.  Just search CPK coupon.

The pizza came out puffy for some reason. I don't normally see pizza that looks like a 5 year old kid would make but that's what I got. I ate it anyway, the taste wasn't bad but the service was horrible. I ordered pepperoni and pineapple pizza and got a pizza with few bits pepperoni and five small pieces of pineapple sprinkled on top. This place is a joke. It took 15mins for me to be acknowledged at the bar counter and they weren't even busy, I came after the lunch rush. Not sure what it is about this area but I encountered poor service here and at the place next door "Copper Canyon". Maybe the same people work in both places?

We have always had excellent food here;however, the service is the issue.  They tend to be VERY slow.  So if you want a quick bite before catching a movie I would not suggest going here.  If they are busy/packed, it can get VERY loud in there.  It is basically one big room.  It is nice to sit outside overlooking the lake, if you can get a seat out there.

We went on a Sunday evening at 730pm. Our service was excellent by Nathan. We had the sangria and the red wine flight, which were good. We had the arugula/asparagus small plate app which was really good. Kids food is plentiful and good. We ordered the chicken chimmichurri and the artichoke/spinach pizza which were shockingly fresh and tasty. The brownie with ice cream was great. I am still surprised at how good the food was, we will definitely be back!

Extremely slow service.  It took 5 min. to be seated. 15 min. to get drinks, 25 min. to get our food (4 people).   My coworker and I were hoping to leave the restaurant within 45min. but that certainly did not happen.  Not a place for a quick lunch. The food was good but high in calories. I couldn't find a decent dish that was less than 500 calories.  Crazy. Also, my coworker's pizza was undercooked.

The food was just OK, the problem is that we ordered a Margarita Pizza and we wanted some arugula to put on top. The manager told our server that this would be an extra $9 each!  Our server was able to supposedly negotiate this down to $4 if she just brought a small plate with some arugula (remember, a large bag of arugula at Trader Joe's is 2 bucks. When the check arrived, she said that the manager added $6 to the bill!  This place is obviously not well managed. Never going back.

Went for another visit after 3 years and it wasn't so great. All servers and hosts are high school students who try to avoid the guests as much as possible. So service sucked. Food took about 40 mins to get ready. I had the fish tacos, they were ok.  Overall, I will not be coming back.

Not the biggest fan of their pizzas, but not their fault. I simply like a big, greasy, New York style pizza with lots of cheese and toppings! This is good and gourmet however. The other dishes I've had are excellent! The fettuccine alfredo may be the best I've ever had. The jambalaya is also very good. Love the lettuce wraps too. They have a great menu with a huge variety of selections, so you should have no problem coming here finding something you'll like.

Yummy yummy yummy! Stick to the pizzas and you will be happy. The tostada pizza is amazing...thin crust, lettuce, black beans, cheese and salsa. If you're looking for something different give the tostada a try. Their healthy menu is pretty bland. I tried the  chimichurri chicken and vowed to never wonder from the pizza menu again. They also list calories for those of us who are counting. Customer service is speedy and commendable.  Enjoy!

What is happening with this place?  I got a pizza today delivered by waiter on the way that was cold and tough!  Yes, tough.  I could hardly tear off the crust.  I ordered extra pepperoni and got 1.5 slices per slice of pizza.  Not much.  I order from them often, but I think I am done.  They have screwed up the last 5 out of 6 orders in some way.  Off to Coal Fire!
Service is great. Food is just ok. I have a family of 6, and it bothers me that they add gratuity on the tab for me. The server would of gotten a bigger tip. I'll be back.
Sat at the bar. Had great service. Bud Light was big and freezing! Tortilla soup was great. Had a great time.

The service and prices are friendly while the atmosphere and location is great. The food is just okay. This is just the go-to spot when you sort of want pizza or pasta and don't want to go far but don't want to go to the new downgraded Cheesecake factory at Montgomery Mall.

CKP is actually really good! The club pizza mmmmmmmmm!! It's so good! & the avocado egg rolls!! Are to die for! I been here before and the service is really good!  I once celebrated my bday and they gave me a dessert and unfortunately they didn't have any candles buuuuut the server pulled out his iPhone and uses an app with a candle. It's the time and thought it took that was nice.  The servers are always great had different ones every time I visit but always great service.  Take out at a separate side is actually really good! :)

Decent food, ok drinks, ok service somehow makes it an above average option in the foodie black hole that is Rio. Nothing blew me away but nothing disgusted me (ahem BGR/Guapos/Wine store) Strictly mediocre

I had been to many other CPK locations and had only ordered pizza because obviously that's what they are known for.  This go around I decided to order other food items.  I have to say that I found them just as tasty as their pizzas.  I took a chance an ordered white corn guacamole which you wouldn't expect at a pizza place.  It was a pleasant surprise for an appetizer.   I also ordered the BBQ chicken salad.  If you are super hungry or want to share it with one other person then I recommend ordering a whole salad.  If you aren't that hungry then a half one would be good enough.  The salad was fresh and there wasn't any brown lettuce which is always a plus.  I'm usually skeptical about ordering salad due to the fact that I had finding any type of brown lettuce in it.  This was good not to have to worry about that.   Overall a good experience and will continue to go back to CPK.
Nice place. Good menu including items for vegetarians plus full bar. Very friendly staff.

Habenero Carnitas Pizza - 3/5. It's A-OK! The habenero sauce is great and gives you that tingly, numbing mouth feel. Best part is that you get to put on as much (or little) as you desire. The only downside is that the carnitas seemed a bit on the dry side from being twice cooked (cooked normally then baked).
Smallest pizza everrrr for 13 dollars more like a personal size pizza.  I don't mind paying for quality but no just no

Regretfully, I have to write this review.   Let me start off by saying that I am new to the Gaithersburg area, and have had positive experiences with CPKs in VA.   I love the tricolore pizza salad and was so glad to see that it has returned to the menu. I placed my order online, which is quick and easy to do.  I was thrilled to see that the location in Gaithersburg RIO has parking spaces allotted for curbside pickup (according to their website).     When I arrived on a Sunday around 4:45pm, there was NO parking available.  The parking spots designated for curbside pickup were all taken by people who were NOT there for the curbside pickup, because no one was inside those vehicles.   There was no parking along the side area or on the street, so I went around the block (which was not quick due to all the people walking about).    I finally pulled into the area next to potbelly (which is a pseudo alley/dead end).   I called to tell the host my location, and he assured me that my food would be right out (by this time, I am late picking up my order).    I waited about 10 minutes, and then called back again.  This time a female answered and said it would be out shortly.   It finally arrived, I tipped the host, and started to drive away and thought I should glance in the bag.   I had 2 friends back at my place and we were going to share the tricolore pizza salad, bread, and split a pudding.    I saw that they forgot the bread.   ugggh.   I called back to tell them  and suddenly, he claimed that we had a bad phone connection.   Ok, so  I repeated it several times, and told him that I am driving around the block again.  When I made it back to the place, there was a spot available in front of the restaurant.   It was another 7 minutes, and finally he came running out with a small baggie with these tiny pieces of 1" diameter bread.   It looked like they cut a baguette.   What happened to the good bread that CPK always served?  Of course there were 3 of us, and now we have 4 tiny pieces of bread to share.    After I arrived home and took the salad out of the bag, I noticed that the plastic container was about 1/3 full.   The pizza crust was as hard as a rock.   The pudding looked sad.  I was embarassed to share this sad meal with my friends, especially after I highly recommended CPK to them. Overall this was a bad experience.   The cooks were not on point.   The host could not hear.   The parking was bad.    We were all sad.   :-(

I have always enjoyed CPK and was thrilled to see that I had finally moved somewhere that had one. We wet in and were seated immediately. The waitress was right there as soon as we were seated. She brought our drinks out and took our orders. She even helped when we couldn't remember what we had had another time. The pizza was brought quickly. And the waitress managed to make her walk-by's inconspicuous enough that we didn't feel rushed at all. As soon as we had paid the manager came by and gave even more of the rewards program "cards". We will definitely be back.

My friends and I came here on a Saturday evening and were surprised we didn't have to wait long. I was trying to decide whether to get pizza or pasta. I ended up getting my favorite here, the Chicken Tequila Fettucine.  Definitely, can't go wrong with this. It is spinach fettucine, chicken, bell peppers, and red onions over a jalapeno lime sauce. This is really good and tasty. It is not too heavy and you won't regret devouring the entire plate! One of my friends ordered the pesto penne.  I did not try it. It looked tasty, but my friend did not seem too impressed. My other friend ordered the Habanero Carnitas pizza, which came with a sauce on the side.  I wish I had tried it, but he finished it too quickly. haha California Pizza Kitchen always has reliably good food. Not superbly awesome, but good. I'd definitely go back. Just remember to get the app so you can get a free small plate!

This is my second time visiting a California Pizza Kitchen. The first time I ever went to one was in Kansas City and maybe it was what I ordered, but it has taken a lot for me to come back. This California Pizza Kitchen blew it out of the water for me with service and food! :)  I LOVED the seasonal California Fields Salad! SO MUCH FRUIT ON A SALAD! If you are obsessed with watermelon and strawberries, this IS the salad for you! Every single bite was "heaven on earth". I even had the strawberry lemondade! Yum yum. Kind of sour, but it was tasty. My classmates had the Chipotle Pizza and the Jumbalaya pasta, which they both loved. Never seen anyone devour an entire pizza on their own so quickly! I even ordered a 'to go' pizza. Barbeque chicken! Smelled great and my boyfriend thought it was mighty tasty! Service was great and very chill place to swing by and eat at for lunch! :) Will definitely be coming back!!

This place is great. It's far from where I live, but whenever I am in the Rio area, I prefer going here over the other restaurants in the Rio area. I tend to stick to my favorite items, which include the lettuce wraps, pizza, and my boyfriend likes the fish tacos. He says they are the best fish tacos in this area. We always sit at the bar, which has seats or the seats are available relatively quickly. Otherwise, there's quite the line for seats so this restaurant is doing something right.  It's a bit loud, but somehow when I sit down at the bar, it doesn't feel as loud as it does at the entrance. I can have a nice conversation without screaming at the top of my lungs. The price is fair and the food is good.

This being my first time at CPK I was a bit hesitant about coming in. My family and I came in after ten and we were seated within seconds. Our waitress was very sweet and our food came out quick. The Sicilian pizza exceeded my expectations and I was delightfully surprised by the strawberry-mango cooler. So glad we decided to drop in tonight!

I have eaten here in many different cities- this time it was Gaithersburg, MD.  This is a well run, consistent establishment where the food and drinks are always good and plenty.  I had the Thai salad with peanuts and shrimp- it's my favorite- delicious and full of good fiber to keep me full. The service is quick and the staff is always well trained.

I went to CPK tonight for dinner. The service was good the ppl was polite and food was good. I got the four cheese ravioli and it was good. My daughter got the fussli with meat sauce, it was a little dry. The spinach dip was good. When they first brought it out it was cold but they re did it, it was fine. I will go back.

A lot of variety to choose from and good food. I like coming here with a group of friends because there's something for everyone: my favorite is the chipotle chicken pizza. The small plates are good to choose from, the pasta is good, and there is a bunch of pizza options to choose from. Their drinks are good here too, so it's a great place for a fun afternoon or evening.  The food comes pretty quick and the service is great. It's one of the better chain restaurants out there because they have consistency. It's usually always packed whenever I go, so sometimes it's good to make a reservation ahead of time. I love their deep fried Mac & cheese (small plates).

Always come here to get good pizza and it's a relaxing place by the river in the center. Service was very good and the guy let us choose a better table to sit at. Asked us how we were doing multiple times. The California pizza kitchen has options that they love most on the menu and we got those and they were the best. My personal favorite is the California club with all the avocados. My too salty!

Waiter literally took my plate away from under my last slice of pizza, suddenly frantically telling us we have to leave because it's 20 minutes past closing.  "Can I get you to-go cups for your cokes??" Pfft. We were being extra friendly with him the entire time too. (My friend even gave him one of her dumplings to try.) Food is average. Experience is boring and dry - you can tell the place is tired.  I used to love their Greek pizza and they took it off their menu. Crust is so yummy but pizza is underwhelming.
This place is good when you are so hungry and you want a delicious food  . I love their pizza and salad

I have been here once before with not so memorable an experience. This was much better. Good sized cocktail. Very attentive server- Alex! Food had good flavor I like the flexibility of the menu allowing appropriate serving sizes. I would come back.

The last time I was in a California Pizza Kitchen was in Montgomery Mall years ago.  It was crowded and noisy and I don't even remember what I ordered. So when a friend recommended meeting for lunch at California Pizza Kitchen in Rio I was lukewarm about the idea, but the location was just so convenient to both of us. The California Pizza Kitchen in Rio was much roomier.  It wasn't real busy when we arrived, but even with that it was laid out much nicer for a casual, catch-up lunch between two old friends.  We were seated in a booth with a view of the lake and the "board walk", perfect for enjoying the water view and for people watching. When my friend and I both ordered a glass of White Zif our waiter suggested we order a bottle and take whatever we didn't drink home.  With the price per glass versus a bottle we agreed it was a good idea.  Since my granddaughter was spending the night with us, I figured the odds of my having pizza for dinner were pretty high, so reluctantly I opted for a bowl of Tortilla soup instead of one of their pizzas.  It was rich and creamy and I couldn't even finish the bowl.  My friend ordered a sautéed veggie salad.  It looked good and she claimed all their salads were delicious.  Our waiter was perfect In checking on us occasionally, but obviously realizing we had settled in for a lot of chatting, not rushing us.   The menu had a lot more choices than just pizza.  A bowl of pasta and a pizza that went past us while we ate both looked good.  I will go back again and look forward to exploring the menu a little bit more.  And I will look forward to enjoying another glass of White Zif while enjoying the view of the lake.

I used to always get the pizza. But now I get a collection of the small plates. I lo e the corn guacamole. The flatbread. The asparagus arugula salad. I'm always a little disappointed with the drinks so I stay simple. I do want to add I took my son recently for a birthday party and the staff was amazing. I had 10 12 year old boys which isn't easy. As usual the food was great.
I went there for a take out order. It was ready when I got there and the cashier was really nice. It was a nice in out situation which I really appreciated it. They were polite.

Great pizza, which I got as a carryout and brought back to the hotel. Yummy. Two complaints. First, the online ordering said it would be 20 minutes. It was closer to 30.  Second, the gal put plenty of napkins in the bag but no plasticware. I had to go back and get it, otherwise the dessert would have been tough to eat. Tip: Mac & cheese bites. Get them.

The hostess first attempted to seat us at a booth sandwiched between the kitchen entrance and a very large party in corner booth (like 8 people) when there were plenty of other tables available. She seemed way more annoyed than she should have been when I politely asked if we could sit a few tables down (still adjacent to other customers also). I didn't see what the big deal was but she acted almost personally offended.  Our waitress was very nice and helpful and attentive; she seemed newer. She was very accommodating for all our requests, although we felt rather rushed immediately... we were seated about 40 minutes before closing. As soon as she took our drink orders, she asked if we were ready to order our food. Bad sign. She mentioned how the kitchen was "wrapping things up" and that there was only a little bread left, which we requested immedately. I mean... really? Their own advertised hours are until 11pm on a Friday night, and there was a minimum of 20 other tables in all areas of the restaurant still seated. They're wrapping up? We didn't walk in 10 minutes before closing; we walked in 40 minutes before closing.  That brings me to my biggest complaint. Only 30 minutes after their advertised closing time I wasn't able to even order a ready-made dessert TO GO because "the kitchen would flip out". Restaurants shouldn't be "OPEN" until 10pm or 11pm if they're going to shut down the kitchen exactly at closing time. Nobody can order and eat dinner in five minutes. If a place isn't not willing to actually serve customers a full menu for a normal amount of dinner time, then close at 10:30. Close at 10:00. Don't say "We're open until 11pm" and tell me the kitchen will flip out at 11:29 if I want to order a dessert to go. It's not like they even would have had to make anything. Cut a slice of pie/cake, plop it in a box, done. Nope, apparently at 11:29pm, that was just too much for them. I wish our server had at least given us notice about it so we could have ordered earlier or something. It wasn't her fault that the kitchen staff was apparently going to bite her head off (she seemed almost nervous at the thought, as she mentioned that another table had requested something TEN MINUTES EARLIER and the kitchen gave her a really hard time about that also). So... apparently CPK only wants your money if you can get in there an hour before closing and be completely finished your meal so they can all go home.

It's hard to find anything not to like at CPK. Their food is excellent, the wait staff is attentive and the location terrific. If I have a beef, it's simply that the place is too popular and noisy from the packed crowd... but then I often use the carryout area so problem solved!
Try the Chipotle pizza, it's awesome! Nice environment both inside and out. The Rio area is nice for families.

Yeah - this place is awesome.  Prices are reasonable.  The food was delicious.  I had the Spicy Chipolte Chicken.  I never had a pizza like it.  I really enjoyed it.  I can't wait to go back to this place.  Great atmosphere.  Wide open, fun, and great for just hanging out.  The waiter was very nice & attentive.

Went there for a business luncheon. Slow service. They were disorganized when our group of 15 showed up, despite calling the day before. They were not busy and staff was standing around, no manager was readily available. Male host was clueless about our scheduled arrival. Food is typical, mediocre for the price. Go there maybe, but there are better options around especially in the Rio. Small servings for the price.
Awesome veg spring rolls, crispy and tasteful. Good pasta options. Must visit if you stay around in Mariott

Great place to go with a large group.  My co-workers and I go here to celebrate birthdays at least every other month or so.  We have a group of 14 people and they usually combine all the middle seats together.  Service is pretty good and the food comes out at a decent pace.  We all order their pizzas and leave pretty satisfied.  We also have two vegetarians in our group, so they appreciate the menu items that cater to them.  We'll probably be back in another month or so.

Very disappointed, place was empty at 6pm. Waiter didn't bring all the food and never came back to check. Manager stopped by to see how everything was, I informed her of my disappointment and she offered to get it for me after we were done eating. Not a good experience in my opinion.

The thai crunch salad is bomb, but too expensive for what it is. Seems to be the theme, pretty good food, slightly too small portions(on some things, like the spinach dip,) but overall good food. Just wish they were like 15% cheaper, but that has to be because of the chain / costs.

We just ordered take out from the Gaithersburg,MD CPK location. Everything was very tasty both salads were fresh and plentiful. We also got the spicy chicken tinga quesadilla, tortilla spring rolls and the salted caramel pudding. Yum to all it! Service was quick and accurate. Although the portion sizes for the quesadilla was much smaller than the size when you eat in. The pudding was served in a small plastic 6oz water cup! Not nearly the size of the glass jug they picture it in.  It was half the amount! Two salads, two appetizers and one dessert and I'm over $50 a bit pricey for such a small amount of food. Check out my picture of the dessert in photos. BTW the caramel pudding was delicious just wish there was more to share.

Walking into any California Pizza Kitchen always makes me feel like I'm in the USA, in a chain restaurant in the the same way Pizza Hut does. However the experience is always much better and you don't feel like you've just eaten pure lard. I digress!!  We were seated immediately in a booth seat, our waitress was everything you want a waitress to be, efficient, informed and pleasant without being overbearing.   I ordered the mushroom, sausage GF pizza which looked great. Let's start by talking about the base. The texture itself was pretty good, soft and fluffy in the centre with a crusty edge. However, the taste let it down somewhat, it was just a tad flavourless and bland. Luckily the toppings made up for the bases shortcomings.  My partner had the avocado, salad, chicken, bacon pizza. The toppings on his were amazing. He said the base was good too. I went for the mango nonfat yoghurt smoothie. It was delicious, plentiful and comparable to any good mango lassi.  There wasn't much waiting around for your food, they were on it! And when the food did come out it was well presented and hot. All in all a pretty enjoyable evening

I usually frequent this place with family or with just me and my 2 year old. If this was a review by my 2 year old then it would get 5 stars! The pizza here to me is just ok, not bad and not stellar either. So would I come here by myself? Probably not. Gets a solid 3 stars for me because the pizza is decent and they have other items that are ok too. Lettuce wraps are good and I think it's the jambalaya that's good too. Overall a good place to eat with a large group or family. When the weather gets nice, it's also great to sit outside and enjoy a beer/wine with a view of the water. The Good: great for kids and large groups. Pizza is decent, lettuce wraps are good. Good service. Great for change of pace kids birthdays! The Bad: nothing sticks out as great, everything is just mediocre. If you want great pizza look elsewhere. Shouldn't come here by yourself unless you're drinking by the bar. The Ugly: nothing terrible here.

Ok I'll start out by saying I've eaten at a clai. Pizza before , very impressed with that location ! This particular location is by far the most disrespectful place I've ever stepped foot in . From the hostess that feels the need to try and degrade people on the phone before they even arrive at the establishment. Then the waitress that we saw hmmmm I wanna say about 3 times the whole time we were there , keep in mind we had a party of 7 ! So from time to time I'd like a drink because mines been empty for 15 mins ! Just saying. Then the food lets get started on that , if the pizza that o ordered was offered as a thin crust and shows up to the table as regular crust uhhhh wtf??? " oh sir the thin crust machine is broke " ! Ok so let me know that before I order I would've gotten something else ! Really one of the worst experiences I've had in a long time ! Sorry for them as I'll never come back to this location ever again.

I love the California Club Pizza, but the crust is very rubbery since they aren't able to do thin & crispy. The toppings are great, but I feel like I'm eating a tire. Their desserts are delicious, but pizza is in their name so it's kind of an important part of the menu.
The pizzas here are okay. I haven't dined in much because I usually get carryout. Their salads are really good!
The service is slow sometimes but usually the staff is very friendly. It's great for kids and the food is really good.

Our waitress Noelle was fantastic, she handled our table of 12 with patience and grace.  The hummus, avocado wraps, lettuce wraps, cheese ravioli, and mushroom pizza were all delicious.  I'd definitely come back!

Wow this place was soooo crowded!  Partly because it was a Saturday night and partly because there was a high school prom somewhere in the area. We ended up seated at a high top table, not a problem as long as we didn't have to wait for two hours!  We had the spinach and artichoke dip as an appetizer.  I wasn't impressed, it was a bit bland for my taste. My entree was better though. Chicken in a cream sauce with pasta and capers.  Can't go wrong with capers those little things are awesome!  I digress lol... Over all the meal was good my nieces were happy so overall it was a decent meal.

Food 5 stars... Service started at 5 - ended at 0. The waitress we had (Sandy?) clearly was only in it for the big party tables. We ordered a big app and she was wonderful. The moment we split an entree and the manager walked by asking how everything was things went downhill. She offered me a refill; never brought it. I figured she forgot so I asked her again if I could please have one. She apologized and went straight to the party beside us. Took their drink order - came back with their drinks the went to her other small table and talked with them. As soon as I pulled my card out she came right over with the bill. No refill or even acknowledged I still never got one. She took the cards and left. Came right back said thanks and ran off to the other table.  Maybe if we felt like she cared she would've been tipped better - but when you totally ignore us because we didn't buy as much food as another table and we can clearly see how you are sucking up to others we will give you what you earned. Pretty sad cause we usually give no less then 20-25%.
You know I love this place. You can't ever go wrong! Anything on their menu is mouth watering and fullfilling! Too bad it's so far from where I live at this time

Seating (EEK! MEthinks not): Beer pong tables paired with mismatched chairs. Utensils (EEK! MEthinks not): One fork had a small piece of lettuce that was leftover from a previous guest. Soda (EEK! Methinks not): Ordered a ginger ale which had a lemon seed in it? Appetizer (Meh. I've experienced better): Dumpling..or dumpling soup as I would like to call it because of all the extra water floating around - was subpar. Entree (OK): All 3 pizzas came out slightly warm. Didn't find that too comforting especially since there weren't many guests during the times that we were there. However, pizzas weren't too bad. It would've been a great experience if my friends and I were eating at a hole in the wall place, but this is CPK and our bill was $60+. Get it together.

Be warned. We went to be seated and I looked down to see a cockroach right smack near the far end of the table in broad light. I mentioned it in shock and the waitress said "oh never mind" and sat us at a different table.  The second star is because our waiter was excellent and the food was decent. I'm sure a lot of places get roaches, but on your table?? This tells me it's either traveled on a surface somewhere or is hiding near where people eat since the kitchen is way in the back and we were seated right up front. I know, you're asking "why would you eat there," but my partner didn't want to leave and both of us were in the "do we be rude and walk out," mindset. I'd normally not post something like this, but hope the restaurant might address what is clearly a health issue.

My special thanks for my waiter and the manager, they were simply wondeful, going an extra mile to provide us with an outstanding dining experience on our wedding anniversary,  even my 10 and 11 yrs old sons made coments such as "wow they made us feel very special".   Food was great, service was prompt and accurate,  we are definitely coming back.

I'm sorry to say that the service at this location really seems to have gone downhill. I have eaten here a few times in the past few months and its been pretty much the same but I will confine this review to my experience today. My mother and I came in for lunch. We were sat promptly at a booth (as requested) but it took quite a while for our waitress to great our table. Our drinks were brought in a reasonable amount of time and our order was taken. My mother ordered a chicken dish with the sauce on the side. When the food was brought out, the sauce was not on the side. What I thought odd was that the young woman who brought the food acknowledged that the food was prepared incorrectly and basically asked my mom if she just wanted to eat it anyway or if she wanted them to fix the mistake. So, they knew it was wrong and rather than fix the problem in the kitchen, they took a shot at just serving it anyway. We asked that the food be repaired as requested, so they took it back and left me with my food and the uncomfortable choice of eating it while my mom waited for her food or letting it sit and get cold. Once her order came out properly, the food was tasty and the rest of the meal was uneventful. So, overall, nothing overtly unpleasant happened, it just seems like they aren't trying very hard and customer service is not one of their main focuses.

We go here frequently. We always order the same thing, and We enjoy it every time. Our server tonight Joshua was great.  The food always tastes fresh. We like the hot bread that comes before the dinner.  Lettuce wrap, wild mushroom pizza, Kungpao spaghetti are all fantastic.  Peach ice tea is a must-have too. This place is sometimes a little loud but it is because it is so popular. This is a great place for casual dinner.  Walk around Rio after dinner feels great too.

Always enjoy going to CPK!!!  Can't get enough of the California Club Pizza and the Kung Pao Spaghetti!  Very tasty dishes among others.  The bar area is nice to sit at as well as the comfortable booths.  Service has been on par the many times my wife & I have visited.  We'll definitely be going more often in the near future.  And it's great there's a reward membership to the restaurant as well.

My parents were visiting me, and we decided to go to Rio to watch a movie and walk around a little bit. We didn't know there was a CPK here, so we decided to stop by for dinner.  Our waiter, Anthony, was absolutely awesome. We could really tell he was a genuine guy and was really putting effort into serving us. He was on-the-ball, and would refill our drinks or tend to us without us having to put a hand up or look for him.  We ordered: Spinach and Artichoke dip with chips, BBQ chopped salad, basil cream pesto pasta, and Hawaiian pizza.   All were delicious! Spinach and artichoke dip with chips is a no-brainer every time I go to CPK. The pizza was fresh and the pasta was cooked well (al dente - has some chew and not too soft, which is exactly how I like it).  One of the nicer CPK's that I have been to; its surrounding area has a plethora of retail shops and the interior is nicely decorated.  Thanks CPK for the great dinner while I had my parents here, and thank you Anthony for the outstanding service!

Since I had a reward expiring soon, I decided to give California Pizza Kitchen another chance (after not being impressed with their Side Waldorf Salad at their Make A Wish Foundation Fundraiser a few weeks ago). Our server Sandy was friendly, helpful, polite, and professional. For drinks, my mom and I got freshly brewed, unsweetened iced tea but I decided to add a flavor, I had the choice among peach, mango, strawberry, and raspberry, and eventually picked Raspberry. We shared a salad, a dinner entree, and pizza.  Instead of trying a salad from the menu, we decided to try the seasonal feature: Harvest Kale Salad without goat cheese, which consisted of baby kale, toasted farro, roasted butternut squash, Napa cabbage, shaved pear, marinated cranberries, and spiced pecans tossed with spicy and tangy citrus vinaigrette. When I asked for extra dressing on the side, the dressing was much thicker and stronger in taste than I expected. The Hearth Roasted Halibut and The Original BBQ Chicken Pizza stole the night. The Hearth Roasted Halibut consisted of wild caught Alaskan halibut roasted on a cedar plank with grilled asparagus and butternut squash farro and baby kale in a creamy tomato sauce. The Original BBQ Chicken Pizza consisted of BBQ sauce, smoked Gouda, red onions, fresh cilantro, and fresh pineapple. That's definitely my ideal pizza. I like how they drizzled BBQ sauce on top of the pizza.
Great cheese and tomato basil pizza! Awesome service from Anthony our server! The pizza was hot and fresh there was no wait! I like the flavored tea I had peach

My coworkers and I came here for a fundraising happy hour on a Thursday night.  I've been here before, but this was my first happy hour. Despite the restaurant being fairly empty, the bar service was really slow.  I mean, so slow, that 5 of us were able to get seats at the bar sitting next to each other, slow.  We waited a long while for our bartender/server to even acknowledge us.  When he finally came, I assume we looked like we weren't as ready as he liked, so he moved on and started doing something else. We waited some more. Finally got to put in our orders, both drinks and food.  Drinks came fairly quickly, but 30 mins later, still no food.  So, I asked nicely... "just wondering, are our orders coming out soon?  We're super hungry." He says "oh you want me to put your food orders in?" I have no words for what I was thinking at that point. Apparently, he thought we were waiting for more people and wanted to wait.  However, we're at the bar... on separate checks... why would we wait??? Anywho, we planned to leave at that point, but some more coworkers showed up, so we decided to stay. Another server took over for us and we were way happier.  Our food came fairly quickly after that. Despite the service, the food was delicious.  Thank goodness, because that somewhat redeemed my evening.  Plus it helps that my friends were there.

Awesome place. Even though the place was almost closed when we walked in.. they welcomed us. they were really helpful.. food is awesome.. I highly recommend this place. Keep up the good work guys.. awesom..
I really enjoy coming here!!! I have never had an awful meal (like ever) sometimes you might wait awhile for food... However in this situation it's okay because it's worth the wait.
Service was quick but the food was bad i got the spaghetti and the sauce was watery and there was so little sauce and the noodles where undercooked

Three stars for the redecorating and for my food being really good.  The experience would have been better if our server was more attentive. I came with a group for lunch and it was like she forgot about us. I am not sure if she was having a rough day or if she was new. My boyfriend came the same day for dinner, also with a group, and had a similar experience with a different server. C'mon guys...please don't let this CPK go down the toilet!

I love hitting up California Pizza Kitchen during lunch.  It is very close to my job and we call ahead and pick our orders up.  Their pizza is always so good!  I especially love the pepperoni pizza.  So delicious.  The staff is always so nice and extremely friendly.  I have not dined in due to the time constraints of lunch at work, but I would love to.  Very good pizza and salads!  Oh and let me not forget, the egg rolls!!  Out of this world!!
The Original BBQ Chopped Salads with Avocado slices! Deliciously fresh and fulfilling!

Always a default restaurant since there is something for everyone including the little ones (: However, even though the  food is great, your dinner becomes unmemorable experience if you have a inattentive and unenthusiastic service. Will make sure I don't get the same server next time I go. Don't want to pay close to $100 for a dinner with miserable service.

I have visited CPK in Rio for a very long time and saw their wonderful transformations. I always feel like this place is constantly changing. However, these recent changes have been bittersweet. Sweet because the new look and atmosphere has done wonders on service efficiency and mood boosting energy.  But tonight i was truly disappointed. The managerial service is always accommodating and considerate as he has always been. But our waiters were just subpar, unwelcoming and not so considerate. don't even get me started on how we had to wait to order. yes, it was busy. but i have seen CPK BUSIER and still be able to be efficient. Not only did a drink come with a dead bug (Dont worry it was just water, but still just as uncomfortable). The menu didn't really impress me as it did before. Some things changed and were added to it, it didn't give off a good group feel that i was hoping for tonight. I thought bringing a group out to eat at CPK would be a good choice but it wasn't all i thought it would be. Too bad my fav restaurant at rio is closed, leaves me with limited choices as to where to eat when i want to hang out with a few friends. Food? you ask? Simple tasting and moderately satisfying. literally all we wanted was pizzas to share together, but i guess it's better to order pizza at home. might think i'm pretty harsh, but let's just say the levels of disappointment is very high considering the fact that i have visited CPK so often i had confidence that it would be a good eating experience.

The last few times we have been in to eat have sucked. There is no other way to put it, my food has been messed up or my drink has. Either way the quality has gone down and the service has as well. I also have ordered take out only to find the wrong food in my bag. When that happened the customer service I receive was horrible. I emailed the manager and she did rectify the situation and was really great about it so we decided to give them another try. That led to the bad service and this long overdue updated review.

First timer. My daughter and I sat on the covered outdoor patio and enjoyed a mushroom pep and sausage pizza. I also enjoyed the Orchard Sangria which was excellent. Highly recommend California Kitchen! Only reason not a 5-star is they do not offer a military discount...and its Memorial Day weekend. Not cool.
A solid three stars. Food was good but not amazing. Staff was welcoming but not overly so. If you want a good pizza, a nice salad and an ice cold beer come here!

Recently we've been trying to make this a regular place since we like the spinach dip, but I think we're about done. The last three times we came nobody greeted us and we sat for like 15 min before somebody even stopped by our table. It's kind of awkward just sitting there. But last night we went to sit at the bar, it was 9:30 pm and they close at 10. We knew it was late, but we just wanted the spinach dip and a pasta. We were greeted by a bar tender who said "hey guys we close in thirty min and I've made a thousand drinks today I don't want to make another". So basically we were kicked out.

I haven't been to CPK in a long time, but popped in yesterday and found a hightop table at the bar. My boyfriend and I sat there for 15 mins without any servers checking in on us the entire time, even though there was a server who served another party just two table next to us! I took my business elsewhere. At least I caught a psyduck here while it was pouring outside.

I work it the building across the street. Our office always orders take out from here. For the amount of money we spend, we should be VIP's here. I like the outdoor seating by the lake, I think customer service is great, the food is good, and prices are reasonable. I feel like the quality or the dishes were better before. I used to looove this place, maybe I just think its just good because I eat it too often. Either way, the pizza is always a good choice and so is their potatoe soup!

i feel like the portions got smaller and the prices went up. the food is good and i love all their salads! i did curb side pick up but there were no spots available and so i did wait near the take out door but it was packed. it was dinner and pokemon go is also super popular so it wasn't bad waiting cus i was able to catch pokemon while waiting :) i did feel bad for waiting on the street and not helping with traffic.

Oh no!! My first "2 star" review!! I ordered two large catering-sized orders of avocado club egg rolls for a potluck lunch at work held for a fellow employee, who is relocating out of state. I called and place my order with CPK a full 24hours in advance, and I specifically asked if it could be delivered between 11:30-11:45am the next day. They also notified me that there is a $10.00 delivery fee.  CPK called me at 10:30am on the day of delivery and confirmed my ordered, took my credit card payment over the phone, and verified that my food would be promptly delivered at 11:45am. By 11:50am, I called CPK to see if the delivery driver was at least on the way, only to be told that my order was not even "ready" yet, but it would be delivered in 10mins. Of course, I questioned how my order was not ready when someone called me over an hour ago confirming my order. Also, with the typical 270 lunch hour traffic, my job is over 15 mins away from CPK, so how would my order be here in 10 mins if it is not even "done". Im very disappointed in the service and as a result, I ended up canceling my order. If they knew they were running behind, I would have appreciated 'a heads up' instead of having me stand outside for 10 mins thinking my food was about to arrive. And when they promised to be there within 10mins, I had a strange feeling they were just saying that to appease me.  Overall, I don't recommend their catering services..but if you do decide to chance it, try to pick up your order instead OR just pay on delivery, cause once they had my $85+ payment, I felt like I was their puppet :( And they better have money!! (shout out to Rihanna) BTW..I gave 2 stars (instead of 1) cause I met with a manager later on that night who apologized for the service and comped an appetizer order of avocado club egg rolls. A Sweet gesture to say the least..

We were seated right away, our waitress was knowledgable of the menu and was on top of keeping our drinks filled.  We had the California Club and it was AMAZING!!! The overall experience was seamless. We will definitely be back!

First, we were waiting for 10 minutes to be seated. The manager saw us standing there and did not do anything. While standing there, a waiter cut through me and my friend just to go see someone outside. Not even excuse me. It was like we weren't even there.  After being seated, our waitress did not show up until 10 minutes later. We ordered out drink and she got that order wrong. I was empty on water and I had to tell her I needed water after she looked at the glass several times.  We haven't gotten our food yet and just being here for 30 minutes things have gone wrong and some rudeness. The pizza was good. The service is slow.

I know not to expect much at most of the restaurants at Rio. Despite the fact that it is a fun place to hang out, there just aren't many places I'm happy spending money for food in here. Today, we decided to give CPK another try after a few years. We ordered the garlic fettuccine alfredo and a five cheese tomato pizza for 3 of us to share.  It's a good thing we don't eat much, because the fettuccine was really abysmal. If you've ever taken leftover alfredo home, you know what happens when you reheat it? The creaminess is gone and you have kind of a butter/cheese split? Yup, that's what we were served. That is not a sauce worthy of any restaurant. Incredibly disappointing. The pizza was fantastic in comparison.  That's the only reason I'll offer up one extra star. I do wish they would be more clear on their menu about which pizzas are 'white', though. My dad really is not a fan of pizzas without tomato sauce and we had to hear it for ordering this one.

Very good food. The service was great. Our waiter Nathaniel was really nice. Unfortunately however, we experienced a very long wait, which was a bit annoying since we purposely came after dinner time so as to avoid such a wait. Still, pretty good!

My boyfriend and I visited this location today for a late lunch and left minutes after being seated. We were greeted and as we walked to our table we were walked through a huge spill. The host didn't acknowledge it, or warn us. I stepped into a huge, sticky puddle which was immediately a turn off. Once we were seated, our host tried to slyly wipe spilled drink and crusted on food off our table. He used a crumbled, previously napkin he had in his pocket. After he seated us, we noticed food covering the floor and table beside us. The man cleaning the table was swiping food off the table and I had some land on my foot. We were the only table seated on this side of the restaurant. At this point, we got up and left the restaurant. The waitress was rude to us when we told her we were not interested in ordering and excused ourselves. I have never walked out of a restaurant before, but I was disgusted. We will now be going to the Montgomery Mall location which has always been clean and well kept.

Date lunch with wife last wknd, pretty good overall food and service. We had the Thai crunch salad and a Margherita pizza and a chocolate souffle, everything was tasty. Very consistent = CPK... We'll be back.

Excellent service! I went with my GF during Memorial Day weekend and the overall experience was great. Andre's service was outstanding. He never left us unattended and was always making sure everything was ok.  We didn't wait to long for the food even though it was super busy.
I went on a day of home coming. The service was bad because the waiter didn't even come back once to refill water. After the server dropped off the food, she disappeared the whole time.
Excellent service.  Great location. Food was excellent.  The baked mac and cheese appetizer was awesome.  Always love this place.  Can't wait to visit again.

Food tasted about average but was surprised at cost and portion size.  Had salad with chicken.  Got 3 cups of salad greens with cheese and dressing for 12 bucks.  Five dollars to add 5 pieces of chicken breast.  Will not visit this establish

California Pizza Kitchen is a typical chain restaurant.  No surprise it offers a multitude of pizzas.  It also has a handful of Salads and Pasta dishes and a variety of apps. Given the standard menu of chains, I won't go to far into their offerings. The quality of the food at this location is good.  They were able to handle my large group (12-15 people) with ease with no reservation.  We had at least 5 different pizzas and nearly every app they had on the menu and all were brought out quickly and enjoyed. Service stands out at this location. Besides being prompt, the staff is attentive and friendly.  They smiles seem genuine and they are happy to help.  We all enjoyed our experience and the quality of the food was only a small part of it. Overall, a clear recommend for me.

We had NATHAN as our server tonight. HE WAS AWESOME and has a GREAT personality. Our food took long, but was worth the wait. My mother LOVED her Ribeye Steak.  My twin sister and I loved our Fettuccine Pasta, and our Appetizer salad. We even had an odd request for cinnamon (to help my mom who's diabetic) and Nathan was so sweet and understanding. EVERYONE MUST TRY THE BUTTERCAKE!!! It's life changing. Thanks Nathan, you're the best!

Made a reservation for a party of 40 @ 7pm.  The coach and team arrived and they told them there was a 35 minute wait. We waited and still no table for party of 40 was available. We then asked to please sit just the players and the coach and they sat them outside.  At 8:30 they brought them waters. I went and complained to the manager and he immediately sent out appetizers to the players and made sure their orders were taken immediately. It was unfortunate they messed up our reservations but the manager really tried to make up for the mistake that was made.
Decent food and service. Either not that great. Ambience is good. Location is nice too. Seating staff is unfriendly and could be arrogant.
Usual cpk awesome pizza.  Weakest drinks ever..$57 worth of top shelgmargaritas for 2 people.. no buzz. Also felt rushed by the waiter

First of all, this is NOT a pizza restaurant. They do serve very small personal pizza, but it's a small part of the menu and marginally OK. Service: SLOW. They were very slow to take our order and even slower in bringing the food.  I ordered a salad with NO meat. The salad had bacon.  The server was a pleasant and the setting was good.  The music was set so we could easily have a conversation.  We won't be going back to California Pizza Kitchen.

The driver for my delivery today was a total idiot! Cannot follow instructions when it was CLEARLY indicated who to deliver it to unless he cannot read. Delivered the order to a wrong person so the restaurant had to prepare my order again. Get rid of this fool!!!

I used to frequent this CPK all the time in high school. Yesterday was my first time back in maybe 6 years. Went with colleagues for lunch. Our waiter was probably 22 or 23, but acted like he was 13. He was a nice kid, but tries to make INCREDIBLY awkward conversation and is just so odd. Also, my friend told him that we needed just another minute to decide and he didn't come back for at least another 10 minutes.  We had noticed that all other tables were given bread as soon as they were seated, but we weren't and had to ask for it as we were ordering our entrees. By the time we ordered and got our food, we had probably already been there for 40 minutes.  I ordered the chicken tequila pasta. The sauce/flavor was delicious, but my fettuccine pasta was SO UNDERCOOKED I was mind blown that they'd serve it. I don't know who the chef was, but anyone who has ever had pasta in their lives could tell that it was super undercooked just by looking at it. All of the noodles were so stiff and it felt like I was eating cardboard noodles. All of my colleagues were surprised by it too. I didn't want to send it back because we only had an hour for lunch and sending it back and getting a new one would've taken too long, so I just ate it. The sauce made it kind of bearable, but I'm still shocked the chef couldn't tell the pasta noodles were undercooked.  We asked for our checks and it took another 15 minutes for our waiter to bring them to us. He kept socializing with a group of waitstaff in front of the cash register instead of ringing up our cards. TLDR; Service was awkward and so slow, pasta incredibly undercooked.

So good. I have always liked the food at the chain but here the location was nice and the staff was friendly. We went for afternoon lunch during the week on a day off from work. Overall the waitress was really nice and refilled our waters without hesitation. The food did take a little longer to come out but it was still warm so I can't complain. I could see managers providing on the spot coaching which was good to see too.

I came here on a Monday afternoon around 1 to pick up lunch to go. I got the lunch duo with a mushroom/pepperoni/sausage pizza and the Mediterranean salad. In a moment of poor planning, I ordered at the restaurant rather than ordering online ahead of time. I was told my food would be ready in 10-15 minutes, but really my wait wound up being closer to 30 minutes. While I was waiting, I had a pretty clear view of the kitchen area and could see that my pizza was ready several minutes before my salad and wound up sitting in a box for awhile before my order was done; as a result, my pizza was rather soggy by the time I got to eat it. Other than the sogginess, the pizza was delicious and had a generous amount of toppings and herbs. The salad was also tasty and a good size. The restaurant was pretty busy when I was there, given it was lunch rush hour; it was also MLK day so there might have been more people dining in if they were off work. The interior of the restaurant is pretty big; there is also a bar. There's a designated area for picking up takeout orders near the back of the restaurant, and you can order there too (although again, I'd recommend ordering online). The pick-up entrance is right by the Potbelly entrance.  Overall, I enjoyed the food, but the wait was longer than I'd expected and did damage my experience a bit. The restaurant is very conveniently located; there is free parking and a lot of shopping nearby, as well as the movie theater.

Had to write this review to share an extremely unpleasant experience. It usually takes a lot to upset me - Food and service were ok. Manager was the issue though and extremely inappropriate and vulgar. There was a table nearby with highschool girls and when they left, the manager commented to a server that he'd like to f***k the girls. The server tried to steer the manager away from the rest of the tables & customers, but the manager continued. Who do you complain to when the manager is the issue?!! Absolutely will not return to this place. Manager needs to get his act together and behave appropriately, especially in earshot of customers.

Came here for a snappy lunch with a friend mostly because I was craving pizza. Lots of people in the DMV rave about CPK and despite being a native, I've never been, so I picked it over Blaze Pizza, which was clearly a mistake. After being greeted and seated by an unwittingly creeper waiter, we ordered (pizza obviously) and guac and chips and the five cheese pizza. Honestly, it was underwhelming for a place that specializes in pizza. The thin crust also just did not work. The guac and chips were great though!

I enjoy their signature salad, The Original BBQ Chicken Chopped. I've ordered this salad many times for catering as a large salad or in the individuals packaged lunches.  Tonight the restaurant was filled with families at almost every table and it was very busy.  I assume it was so crowded due to tomorrow being a holiday and children are out of school.  We arrived at 8:30pm and had to wait about 15-20 minutes to be seated. Once seated I could quickly tell the staff was overwhelmed. We had to wait nearly 45 minutes for our food to come out. My daughter stated there wasn't enough sauce for her alfredo pasta but she was quickly brought some additional sauce over to our table.  We also tried the butter cake topped with a scoop of vanilla ice cream and garnished with whipped cream. The butter cake came out really fast- I wish our food came out so quickly.

I have never yelped before but this was one of the worst experiences I've ever had and that too on Valentine's Day.  The food was good, my husband and myself ordered the spinach artichoke dip as an appetizer, which was warm and rich. We ordered the pesto penne pasta, extremely delicious and creamy and margarita pizza, our servers recommendation which wasn't exciting at all, for entrees. The service was absolutely the worst. Our server was Vanessa. She didn't smile once and kept touching her face when she was talking to us. We asked what she recommended and what she liked. Her descriptions were half-assed and we could tell she didn't know about the menu and she wasn't engaging.  When we got our food, initially we didn't like the pizza. We waited and waited for our server to come back and check on us and that didn't happen. We ordered desserts when she finally came around and requested a check immediately. We felt like we were being ignored and not wanted there at all. I will be returning to California pizza kitchen for their food bur their service was piss-poor.

This was good.  The server was great. The food was fast and tasty.  I got the pizza and salad lunch combo.  It has been a while since I have been to a CPK, but based on this experience I would come back soon.   I got the pepperoni pizza and salad. I was not a fan of the seasonal strawberry beverage.   What did I learn today?  In a sea of bad restaurants in that area, CPK stands apart for service and quality food.

Not a bad place to grab some food if you're in the area. Known for the pizza obviously, but they also have good pasta. I ordered the Pesto Cream Penne with chicken. Only disappointment is that it's an extra $3 to add hardly any chicken.
